items.content_html:
Summary

This pull request is a follow up to #19148 for adding to the browser compat table chrome versions in which support was added for scroll-timeline shorthand and longhand properties.

Accordingly, this pull request also makes minor updates to the Firefox entries to add notes to explain the changes that happened in those versions.

All the properties in both Chrome and Firefox are still behind the experimental flag/preference.

Chrome version support

Source for information for Chrome versions: mdn/content#25105 (comment)

version 111: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1357795
version 107: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1317765
version 88: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1074052#c35

Note

I do not have any explicit information about support in Edge.

Related issue

Doc issue tracker: mdn/content#24396
items.title: Update Chrome versions for scroll-timeline shorthand and longhand properties

This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing features of the contains member of the Document API. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v8.1.2).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

items.content_html:
ðŸ‘‹ Hi, Chrome DevRel here!

This PR adds the linear easing function.

  • Spec: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/css-easing/#the-linear-easing-function
  • Blink/Chromium I2S: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/Q7fjvM9Mn0c/m/Mz14zzFhAAAJ
  • ChromeStatus Entry: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5139710823890944
  • Gecko/Firefox I2S: https://groups.google.com/a/mozilla.org/g/dev-platform/c/BxEIDf22HmM/m/dlUckNABBgAJ

AFAIK there is no MDN entry for this.
items.title: Add the linear easing function

Summary

Added data for the prefers-reduced-transparency media query as Firefox now supports in 113 behind a pref.

Test results and supporting details

New WPT tests: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/css/mediaqueries/prefers-reduced-transparency.html

Gecko bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1736914
WebKit bug: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=175497 (unimplemented)
Blink bug: Does not exist currently

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds a compatibility and spec's for the SVG shape-subtract attribute. A follow up to my PR adding this item to the MDN docs.

First time contributor here, please feel free to let me know if there was something I could've done better.

Test results and supporting details

In my testing for compatibility I was unable to find a browser that supported this feature, even though it is on the standards track.

Testing as Not Supported in:

  • Chrome: 110.0.581.178
  • Firefox: 110.0.1
  • Opera: 95.0.4635.46
  • Edge: 110.0.1587.63

But there are some resources that indicate it could be a WIP:

  • Chromium Bug report asking for this feature support
  • Chromium Test Cases for this Feature
  • Firefox Test Cases for this Feature

Also if helpful, the specification.

Related issues

Supplies my companion PR mdn/content#25077 with it's compatibility table and specification link.
items.title: Add `shape-subtract` compatibility data
